Posts.Content: Hello,  I am sorry you have gone through the same as me but also relieved I'm not on my own.  I totally got my head round mastectomy and tbh it was the only thing that made me giggle when talking to people was that I was going to have pre baby good again lol  I am meeting my consultant next Tuesday so it' just a waiting game.  Please let me know what the out come of the phone call is, I am routing for you  xx Kirst xx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello Scarlettem,  All is good here, I am provisionally booked in for a double mastectomy and reconstruction using my own tissues, so in theory I am getting a cheeky tummy tuck at the same time, boots look on the bright side.  I have justvrrturned from having a scan as my MRI showed it had gone into my lymph and it was all clear today so that good ;) I am made up you can enjoy xmas with your family before startimg treatment ;)  Xxx
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi,  Just a phone call from my genetics team saying no mutated gene found. This is good news. I am now sat here sobbing because I am all confused, I was basically advised that due to me being 37 and having bi lateral breast cancer two different types so both primary and a family history of breast and ovarian cancers then it' almost certain to be genetic, now I am just unlucky. Over the last few weeks / months awaiting the results and under going chemo, I have come to terms with a double mastectomy but now don't even know if this is an option.  Will I be told that my only option is lumpectomy with regular checks???  Very confused and seriously don' think I could go through treatment again, my breast don' feel like mine anymore, they feel empty (of that makes sense)  Has anyone else experienced anything like this????  Many Thanks  Kirst x
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hello,  So happy they have listened to you and you can enjoy xmas then start treatment in the New year ;)  I had my last Chemo yesterday and meet with my Oncologist who did not know my appt with surgeon had been cancelled and went on to say she will see me on 8 feb to discuss the text and soft study moving forward with my hormone treatment, as by then I would have had my double lumpectomy as per agreed in their professionals meeting on monday. As you can imagine I am not best pleased and said I want a mastectomy as it' in both breats and different types of cancer.  I know have to wait till Tuesday and hope this appt is not cancelled and fight my corner. Only problem is I know next week is my bad week and often struggle to make the school run let alone a 9am hospital appt lol.  keep in touch  Kirst x
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi Scarlettem,  How did your appointment go on Thursday?, have you been able to delay chemo in order to have Christmas and start in January?  My appointment was cancelled today due to consultant being poorly. My anxiety is through the roof, I just. we'd to know what operation they are going to do although I am still going to push for double mastecomy, think if it was only in one breast the a lumpectomy would be ok but as its bilateral I just want them gone.  Hope your doing ok  Kirsty x
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi Deb09,  I was diagnosed with lubular in my right breast and ductal in I'm my left breadt  6 months ago, at the time I was told lymph was clear. I have done 6 chemo cycles and and now preparing for double mastectomy.  Well, that was till last week, following pre op exam, I now have to have another ultrasound and ct scan as the think it' not started in lymph?  I have two young daughters and at the start of this journey I went out of my mind worrying for them and how are we going to through this, the bottom line is you find a way!!! Please trybtonstay positive. you are going to have good and bad days and that is totally fine but try and make memories and have family time when you feel up to it. Good luck on your journey and remember you are stronger than you think  xc
Posts.Title: Devastated and petrified diagnosed with 2cm lobular breast cancer...

Posts.Content: Hello,  I also have a needle phobia aswell and must say you are doing better than me as you managed a pic line. I stress every 3 weeks and have anti anxiety tablets just for the cannua and once it' in I put a cloth over it and pretend it' not there. I have bilateral breast cancer and both sites have a marker, mine were done pre chemo.  Please don't stress, compared to having a biopsy it's minor. Mindfulness helps. I am on chemo 5 out of 6 and have made the decision for double mastectomy purely for fear of it coming back especially as its currently in both boobs, two different types. If a lumpectomy is what you want then please don't over think the markers, tell staff that you are anxious and they will put you at ease.  I took my friend with me for mine As usually pass out but this time I never, just kept my eyes closed and asked the specialist not to talk me through what he was doing and just get on with. You will be fine xx
Posts.Title: Scared of needles

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry,  You are not alone, I have done my 3 infusions of EC and start Toxotere tomorrow.  I meet with my oncologist yesterday where I had a total breakdown, so unlike me and she has put me on Lorazepam only 6 tablets  but I get so worked up prior to chemo I'm like a spring but find it so hard to uncoil. I am normally the glass is half full sort of person but since chemo it changed to half empty. It's a major rough ride but please try to stay positive and remember it's all for the greater good xx Keep talking to people and remember to Llow yourself little treats, even if it's just having your nails done xx  Always here  Kirst xx
Posts.Title: Chemo induced anxiety & depression
